segments.text: I observe the kitchen with its open cabinets and running water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying a dish, standing in what looks like a growing mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That overflowing sink is disgusting; water everywhere, soaking everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is filthy, probably mixing with dirt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's got one foot in it and doesn't even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the boy is rummaging in the cookie jar like a little thief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His stool is tilting, and crumbs might fall into the water below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is begging for cookies, adding to the sneaky vibe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All this water damage to the cabinets is just gross to see.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The once-clean kitchen is turning into a soggy disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden is neat, which makes the inside look even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand how the mess is spreading unchecked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those poor cabinets, dripping and ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene leaves me feeling queasy.
segments.speaker: PAR
